headline: Does Cboe’s CEDX Exit Reveal a Sharper Derivatives Strategy for Cboe Global Markets (CBOE)?
summary: Cboe Global Markets recently reported stronger quarterly revenue and profit than a year earlier and decided to shut its Cboe Europe Derivatives (CEDX) exchange by February 2026, while signaling that its core European cash equities and clearing businesses will continue unchanged. This combination of exiting a smaller derivatives platform and highlighting solid recent financial performance points to a tighter focus on areas where management sees better risk‑reward within its global...
